docs.lead_paragraph: Hillary Rodham Clinton said today that she would embrace the issue of health care coverage in her probable race for the United States Senate next year, asserting that public concern about the subject had grown since her campaign to change the system collapsed in failure six years ago. ''One of the issues that I will, if I run, emphasize is health care,'' Mrs. Clinton declared, expounding on the issue first before an audience of elderly Long Islanders and then at a news conference.

headline.main: Undeterred by Past, Mrs. Clinton Sees Health Care as Senate Issue

docs.abstract: Hillary Rodham Clinton, speaking at senior center in Great Neck, NY, says that she would embrace issue of health care coverage in her probable race for United States Senate next year, asserting that public concern about subject has grown since her campaign to change system collapsed in failure six years ago; photo (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Re ''Debate on Aid for the Elderly Focuses on Women'' (front page, Sept. 13): Medicare's lack of prescription drug coverage is killing my patients. One of them, an indigent 70-year-old widowed grandmother, required four different medications to manage her soaring blood pressure. The monthly total was $300, almost half her monthly income.
docs.abstract: Dr Anna B Reisman letter warns that Medicare's lack of prescription drug coverage is killing her patients; cites example (Sept 13 article Debate on Aid for the Elderly Focuses on Women)
docs.snippet: To the Editor:    Re ''Debate on Aid for the Elderly Focuses on Women'' (front page, Sept. 13): Medicare's lack of prescription drug coverage is killing my patients. One of them, an indigent 70-year-old widowed grandmother, required four different...

docs.lead_paragraph: Aetna U.S. Healthcare, a unit of Aetna Inc. of Hartford, agreed yesterday to sell its NYLCare Texas commercial operations to Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Texas for $500 million. With the transaction, Aetna U.S. Healthcare fulfills an agreement with the Justice Department and the Texas Attorney General to shed its NYLCare commercial health maintenance organization businesses in the Dallas-Fort Worth and Houston markets. Antitrust regulators required the sale in return for approval of Aetna's $1 billion acquisition of Prudential Healthcare, the health care unit of the Prudential Insurance Company of America. Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Texas, a nonprofit division of the Health Care Service Corporation, said the addition of NYLCare Texas' 551,000 members will increase its membership in Texas to almost 2.7 million.

headline.main: AETNA U.S. HEALTHCARE TO SELL SOME TEXAS OPERATIONS

docs.lead_paragraph: Spending on health care for the growing number of adults who are seriously overweight accounts for almost one-third of the national cost of treating 15 important diseases, including diabetes, heart disease, stroke and hypertension, the Lewin Group, a health care research and consulting group, said yesterday. The study was commissioned by the American Obesity Association, which urges the Government and private employers to give more attention to problems of people who are overweight.

headline.main: Study Says Overweight Adults Push Up Cost of Health Care

docs.abstract: Lewin Group, in study commissioned by American Obesity Association, says spending on health care for growing number of adults who are seriously overweight accounts for almost one-third of national cost of treating 15 important diseases; study urges Government and private employers to give more attention to problems of people who are overweight; finds cost of all treatments for obese adults will be $238 billion in 1999 (S)
